questions.prompt: You validated malware on an HMI with no outage. What should the Incident Commander decide?
options: Declare a full Reportable Cyber Security Incident
Classify as an Attempt to Compromise and start the end-of-next-business-day reporting clock
questions.audit: Classification drives DOE-417 timing and evidence handling.

questions.prompt: Containment isolated the affected server. Who must be notified first based on the communications matrix?
options: Only the person who found it
questions.audit: Communications must follow the documented matrix with time-stamped proof.

questions.prompt: Recovery is complete after restoring from backup. What must the Technical Responder and Incident Commander do before returning to service?
options: Verify clean state with scans and get leadership approval to go live
Ask the vendor to send a note
questions.audit: Return-to-service requires validation evidence and approval.

questions.prompt: A phishing simulation was reported by General Staff. What should Compliance capture?
options: A short log entry noting it was an Attempt to Compromise with timestamps
questions.audit: Even simulations reinforce reporting discipline and evidence habits.
